meanings.sent1: The harsh words from his friend embittered him.
meanings.sent2: The betrayal by his colleague embittered his heart.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled milk embittered his morning coffee.
meanings.sent4: The constant criticism began to embitter her outlook on life.
meanings.sent5: The bitter taste of failure embittered his spirit.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel bitter or resentful
meanings.sent1: Her rude behavior embittered her family towards her.
meanings.sent2: The unfair treatment embittered him against authority.
meanings.sent3: The lost game embittered the team, but they laughed it off.
meanings.sent4: The broken promises began to embitter their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The constant rain embittered their mood during the picnic.
